dinosaurs.name: Velociraptor
dinosaurs.description: Velociraptor is a genus of dromaeosaurid theropod dinosaur that lived approximately 75 to 71 million years ago during the latter part of the Cretaceous Period.
dinosaurs.discovery: Discovered in 1924 by Henry Fairfield Osborn
funFacts: Had feathers, not scales like in movies
Was actually about the size of a turkey
Hunted in packs
Had a sickle-shaped claw on each foot

dinosaurs.name: Triceratops
dinosaurs.description: Triceratops is a genus of herbivorous ceratopsid dinosaur that first appeared during the late Maastrichtian stage of the late Cretaceous period, about 68 million years ago in what is now North America.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1887 by Othniel Charles Marsh
funFacts: Had the largest skull of any land animal
Could defend against T-Rex attacks
Lived in herds
Had a beak-like mouth for eating plants

dinosaurs.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
dinosaurs.description: Tyrannosaurus is a genus of large theropod dinosaur. The species Tyrannosaurus rex, often called T. rex or colloquially T-Rex, is one of the best represented of these large theropods.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1902 by Barnum Brown
funFacts: Had the strongest bite force of any land animal
Could crush bone with its teeth
Had tiny arms but powerful legs
May have been a scavenger as well as a hunter

dinosaurs.name: Stegosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Stegosaurus is a genus of herbivorous, four-legged, armored dinosaur from the Late Jurassic, characterized by the distinctive kite-shaped upright plates along their backs and spikes on their tails.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1877 by Othniel Charles Marsh
funFacts: Had a brain the size of a walnut
Plates may have been used for temperature regulation
Had spikes on its tail for defense
Could grow up to 30 feet long

dinosaurs.name: Brachiosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Brachiosaurus is a genus of sauropod dinosaur that lived in North America during the Late Jurassic, about 154–153 million years ago. It was one of the tallest and largest dinosaurs.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1903 by Elmer S. Riggs
funFacts: One of the tallest dinosaurs ever
Had nostrils on top of its head
Could reach vegetation 50 feet high
Had a long neck to reach tree tops

dinosaurs.name: Spinosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Spinosaurus is a genus of spinosaurid dinosaur that lived in what now is North Africa during the Cenomanian to upper Turonian stages of the Late Cretaceous period, about 99 to 93.5 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1912 by Ernst Stromer
funFacts: Largest carnivorous dinosaur
Semi-aquatic lifestyle
Had a sail-like structure on its back
Specialized in catching fish

dinosaurs.name: Allosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Allosaurus is a genus of large theropod dinosaur that lived 155 to 145 million years ago during the late Jurassic period. It was one of the most common large predators of its time.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1877 by Othniel Charles Marsh
funFacts: Had serrated teeth for tearing flesh
Hunted in packs
Was smaller but more agile than T-Rex
Had three-fingered hands with sharp claws

dinosaurs.name: Diplodocus
dinosaurs.description: Diplodocus is a genus of diplodocid sauropod dinosaurs whose fossils were first discovered in 1877 by S. W. Williston. It is one of the longest dinosaurs known.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1877 by Samuel Wendell Williston
funFacts: One of the longest dinosaurs ever
Had a whip-like tail for defense
Could reach vegetation up to 30 feet high
Had a small head compared to body size

dinosaurs.name: Ankylosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Ankylosaurus is a genus of armored dinosaur. Its fossils have been found in geological formations dating to the very end of the Cretaceous Period, about 68–66 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1908 by Barnum Brown
funFacts: Had bony armor covering its body
Had a club-like tail for defense
Was nearly impossible to attack
Lived alongside T-Rex

dinosaurs.name: Pterodactyl
dinosaurs.description: Pterodactylus is a genus of pterosaurs, whose members are popularly known as pterodactyls. It was the first pterosaur genus to be named and identified as a flying reptile.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1784 by Cosimo Alessandro Collini
funFacts: Actually not a dinosaur but a flying reptile
Had a wingspan of up to 3 feet
Could fly and walk on land
Had a long beak for catching fish

dinosaurs.name: Parasaurolophus
dinosaurs.description: Parasaurolophus is a genus of herbivorous ornithopod dinosaur that lived in what is now North America during the Late Cretaceous Period, about 76.5–73 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1922 by William Parks
funFacts: Had a distinctive crest on its head
The crest may have been used for communication
Could make loud sounds through its crest
Lived in herds for protection

dinosaurs.name: Carnotaurus
dinosaurs.description: Carnotaurus is a genus of theropod dinosaur that lived in South America during the Late Cretaceous period, probably sometime between 72 and 69.9 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1985 by José Bonaparte
funFacts: Had distinctive horns above its eyes
Was a fast runner
Had very small arms
Lived in what is now Argentina

dinosaurs.name: Iguanodon
dinosaurs.description: Iguanodon is a genus of ornithopod dinosaur that existed roughly halfway between the first of the swift bipedal hypsilophodontids and the ornithopods' culmination in the duck-billed dinosaurs.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1825 by Gideon Mantell
funFacts: One of the first dinosaurs ever discovered
Had thumb spikes for defense
Could walk on two or four legs
Had a beak-like mouth for eating plants

dinosaurs.name: Deinonychus
dinosaurs.description: Deinonychus is a genus of dromaeosaurid theropod dinosaur that lived during the Early Cretaceous, about 115–108 million years ago. It was a fast and agile predator.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1931 by Barnum Brown
funFacts: Inspiration for Jurassic Park's Velociraptor
Had a large sickle-shaped claw on each foot
Likely had feathers like its relatives
Hunted in coordinated packs

dinosaurs.name: Apatosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Apatosaurus is a genus of herbivorous sauropod dinosaur that lived in North America during the Late Jurassic period, about 152–151 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1877 by Othniel Charles Marsh
funFacts: Once confused with Brontosaurus
Had a long whip-like tail
Could weigh as much as five elephants
Had a small head for its massive body

dinosaurs.name: Giganotosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Giganotosaurus is a genus of theropod dinosaur that lived in what is now Argentina during the early Cenomanian age of the Late Cretaceous, approximately 99.6 to 97 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1993 by Rubén D. Carolini
funFacts: One of the largest carnivorous dinosaurs
Larger than T-Rex in size
Had blade-like teeth for slicing
Hunted large sauropods

dinosaurs.name: Sauroposeidon
dinosaurs.description: Sauroposeidon is a genus of sauropod dinosaur that lived in North America during the Early Cretaceous, about 112 million years ago. It is one of the tallest dinosaurs known.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1994 by Richard Cifelli
funFacts: Possibly the tallest dinosaur ever
Had an extremely long neck
Could reach heights of modern giraffes
Lived in floodplain environments

dinosaurs.name: Therizinosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Therizinosaurus is a genus of theropod dinosaur that lived in Asia during the Late Cretaceous period, about 70 million years ago. It had long claws and a unique appearance.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1948 by a Soviet-Mongolian expedition
funFacts: Had the longest claws of any dinosaur
Claws could reach up to 3 feet long
Likely used claws to gather plants
Had a bird-like appearance

dinosaurs.name: Megalosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Megalosaurus is a genus of large theropod dinosaur that lived in what is now southern England during the Middle Jurassic, about 166 million years ago. It was one of the first dinosaurs scientifically described.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1824 by William Buckland
funFacts: One of the first dinosaurs named
Had strong, sharp teeth for hunting
Lived in what is now England
Was a bipedal predator

dinosaurs.name: Styracosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Styracosaurus is a genus of herbivorous ceratopsian dinosaur that lived in what is now North America during the Late Cretaceous, about 75.5 to 75 million years ago.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1913 by Lawrence Lambe
funFacts: Had a large nasal horn
Possessed a frill with long spikes
Lived in herds for protection
Related to Triceratops

dinosaurs.name: Oviraptor
dinosaurs.description: Oviraptor is a genus of small theropod dinosaur that lived in Asia during the Late Cretaceous, about 75 million years ago. Its name means 'egg thief,' though it likely ate a varied diet.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1924 by Henry Fairfield Osborn
funFacts: Had a beak similar to modern parrots
Likely cared for its eggs like birds
Had feathers and a bird-like appearance
May have eaten eggs, plants, and small animals

dinosaurs.name: Argentinosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Argentinosaurus is a genus of titanosaur sauropod dinosaur that lived in what is now Argentina during the Late Cretaceous, about 97 to 93.5 million years ago. It is one of the largest dinosaurs known.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1987 by Guillermo Heredia
funFacts: Possibly the heaviest dinosaur ever
Could weigh as much as 17 elephants
Had a long neck for reaching high vegetation
Lived in lush, forested environments

dinosaurs.name: Troodon
dinosaurs.description: Troodon is a genus of small theropod dinosaur that lived in North America during the Late Cretaceous, about 77 to 74 million years ago. It is known for its relatively large brain.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1856 by Joseph Leidy
funFacts: Had one of the largest brains among dinosaurs
Likely had excellent vision and hearing
May have been nocturnal
Could eat both plants and small animals

dinosaurs.name: Edmontosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Edmontosaurus is a genus of hadrosaurid dinosaur that lived in North America during the Late Cretaceous, about 73 to 66 million years ago. It was a large, duck-billed dinosaur.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1917 by Lawrence Lambe
funFacts: Had a duck-like bill for eating plants
Lived in large herds
Could chew tough plant material
Fossils show evidence of skin impressions

dinosaurs.name: Quetzalcoatlus
dinosaurs.description: Quetzalcoatlus is a genus of pterosaur that lived in North America during the Late Cretaceous, about 68 to 66 million years ago. It was one of the largest flying animals ever.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1971 by Douglas A. Lawson
funFacts: Had a wingspan of up to 33 feet
Not a dinosaur but a flying reptile
Could soar like modern albatrosses
Likely scavenged or hunted small prey

dinosaurs.name: Baryonyx
dinosaurs.description: Baryonyx is a genus of theropod dinosaur that lived in what is now Europe during the Early Cretaceous, about 130–125 million years ago. It was a fish-eating dinosaur with a crocodile-like snout.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1983 by William J. Walker
funFacts: Had a large claw on its thumb
Specialized in catching fish
Related to Spinosaurus
Lived near rivers and lakes

dinosaurs.name: Corythosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Corythosaurus is a genus of hadrosaurid dinosaur that lived in North America during the Late Cretaceous, about 77–75.7 million years ago. It had a distinctive crest on its head.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1912 by Barnum Brown
funFacts: Crest used for sound production
Lived in forested areas
Had a beak for cropping plants
Could run on two legs

dinosaurs.name: Dilophosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Dilophosaurus is a genus of theropod dinosaur that lived in what is now North America during the Early Jurassic, about 193 million years ago. It had two crests on its head.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1942 by Samuel P. Welles
funFacts: Had two crests on its head
Not known to spit venom like in movies
Was an agile predator
Lived in a warm, humid environment

dinosaurs.name: Plesiosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Plesiosaurus is a genus of marine reptile that lived during the Early Jurassic, about 199–175 million years ago. It had a long neck and flippers for swimming.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1821 by Mary Anning
funFacts: Not a dinosaur but a marine reptile
Had a long neck with up to 70 vertebrae
Used flippers to swim efficiently
Ate fish and other marine animals

dinosaurs.name: Utahraptor
dinosaurs.description: Utahraptor is a genus of large dromaeosaurid dinosaur that lived in North America during the Early Cretaceous, about 126 million years ago. It was one of the largest raptors.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1991 by James Kirkland
funFacts: Largest known raptor dinosaur
Had large sickle-shaped claws
Likely had feathers
Hunted in packs like Velociraptor

dinosaurs.name: Pachycephalosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Pachycephalosaurus is a genus of pachycephalosaurid dinosaur that lived in North America during the Late Cretaceous, about 70–66 million years ago. It had a thick skull roof.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1938 by William Winkley
funFacts: Had a dome-shaped skull up to 10 inches thick
May have head-butted rivals
Lived alongside T-Rex
Ate plants and possibly small animals

dinosaurs.name: Mosasaurus
dinosaurs.description: Mosasaurus is a genus of marine reptile that lived during the Late Cretaceous, about 82–66 million years ago. It was a top predator in ancient oceans.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1764 near Maastricht, Netherlands
funFacts: Not a dinosaur but a marine reptile
Could grow up to 50 feet long
Had double-hinged jaws like a snake
Preyed on fish, ammonites, and other reptiles

dinosaurs.name: Gallimimus
dinosaurs.description: Gallimimus is a genus of ornithomimid theropod dinosaur from Mongolia. It was a fast, ostrich-like dinosaur.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1964 by Polish-Mongolian expedition
funFacts: Name means 'chicken mimic'
One of the fastest dinosaurs
Had a long neck and toothless beak
Featured in Jurassic Park

dinosaurs.name: Compsognathus
dinosaurs.description: Compsognathus is a small, bipedal, carnivorous dinosaur that lived in Europe during the Late Jurassic period.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1859 by Joseph Oberndorfer
funFacts: Size of a chicken
One of the first small theropods found
Likely hunted small reptiles and insects
Had long legs for speed

dinosaurs.name: Ceratosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Ceratosaurus is a medium-sized predatory theropod dinosaur, recognizable by the horn on its snout.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1884 by Othniel Charles Marsh
funFacts: Had a horn on its nose
Lived alongside Allosaurus
Possibly a scavenger and predator
Had strong jaws and blade-like teeth

dinosaurs.name: Maiasaura
dinosaurs.description: Maiasaura is a hadrosaurid dinosaur known for evidence of parental care.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1978 by Jack Horner
funFacts: Name means 'Good Mother Lizard'
First dinosaur with evidence of nest care
Laid eggs in large colonies
A hadrosaur with a flat beak

dinosaurs.name: Kentrosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Kentrosaurus was a smaller relative of Stegosaurus with spikes on its body.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1909 by German expedition
funFacts: Had spikes along its back and tail
Lived in Tanzania
Could defend against predators with tail spikes
Part of the stegosaur family

dinosaurs.name: Ouranosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Ouranosaurus is a genus of iguanodont dinosaur with a sail-like structure on its back.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1965 by Philippe Taquet
funFacts: Had a sail on its back like Spinosaurus
May have used sail for heat regulation
A relative of Iguanodon
Lived in Niger

dinosaurs.name: Mononykus
dinosaurs.description: Mononykus was a small theropod with a single large claw on each hand, likely used for digging.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1993 in Mongolia
funFacts: Name means 'one claw'
Likely ate insects like termites
Had bird-like features
Adapted for digging

dinosaurs.name: Shunosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Shunosaurus is a sauropod dinosaur from China, notable for its tail club.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1977 in Sichuan, China
funFacts: Had a tail club for defense
One of the most complete sauropod fossils found in China
Lived in herds
Fed on low-lying plants

dinosaurs.name: Huayangosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Huayangosaurus is an early stegosaurid dinosaur from China.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1979 in Sichuan, China
funFacts: One of the earliest stegosaurs
Had small plates and spikes
Smaller than later stegosaurs
Lived during the Middle Jurassic

dinosaurs.name: Dracorex
dinosaurs.description: Dracorex is a pachycephalosaurid dinosaur with a dragon-like skull.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 2004
funFacts: Full name means 'Dragon King of Hogwarts'
Had spikes and bumps on its skull
May be a juvenile Pachycephalosaurus
Named by paleontologists inspired by Harry Potter

dinosaurs.name: Cryolophosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Cryolophosaurus is a theropod dinosaur from Antarctica, known for the crest on its head.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1991 by David Elliot
funFacts: Nicknamed 'Elvisaurus' for its crest
First dinosaur discovered in Antarctica
Crest may have been for display
Lived in a cold environment

dinosaurs.name: Microraptor
dinosaurs.description: Microraptor is a small, feathered dinosaur with wings on both its arms and legs.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 2000 in China
funFacts: Had four wings
Could glide between trees
Had feathers like modern birds
A key fossil for bird evolution

dinosaurs.name: Plateosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Plateosaurus is an early sauropodomorph dinosaur from Europe.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1834 by Johann Friedrich Engelhardt
funFacts: One of the earliest large herbivores
Could walk on two or four legs
Common dinosaur in Triassic Europe
Helped shape understanding of sauropod evolution

dinosaurs.name: Coelophysis
dinosaurs.description: Coelophysis is a small, slender theropod dinosaur and one of the earliest known.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1881 by David Baldwin
funFacts: Name means 'hollow form'
Lived in large groups
One of the first theropods discovered in the U.S.
May have been a cannibal

dinosaurs.name: Herrerasaurus
dinosaurs.description: Herrerasaurus is one of the earliest known dinosaurs, a small carnivore from South America.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1958 in Argentina
funFacts: One of the earliest carnivorous dinosaurs
Had sharp teeth and claws
Walked on two legs
Lived before larger predators evolved

dinosaurs.name: Massospondylus
dinosaurs.description: Massospondylus is a prosauropod dinosaur from South Africa.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1854 by J. W. Broom
funFacts: Could walk on two or four legs
Among the earliest known long-necked dinosaurs
Fossils include embryos
Herbivore with a long neck

dinosaurs.name: Anchiceratops
dinosaurs.description: Anchiceratops is a ceratopsid dinosaur with ornate frills.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1912 by Barnum Brown
funFacts: Had elaborate frill ornamentation
Close relative of Triceratops
Possibly used frill for display
Lived in herds

dinosaurs.name: Psittacosaurus
dinosaurs.description: Psittacosaurus is a small ceratopsian dinosaur from Asia, known for its parrot-like beak.
dinosaurs.discovery: First discovered in 1923 in Mongolia
funFacts: Name means 'parrot lizard'
Had a beak like modern parrots
One of the most numerous dinosaur fossils found
Lived in herds
